The amendment of regulatory legislation in the banking sector (15 May 2020), which allows the nationalized private banks to remain the property of the state, has created the illusion of a confrontation between Zelensky and one of the key oligarchs, Igor Kolomoysky. This law prohibits the restitution of Kolomoysky's rights over the Ukrainian bank Privatbank, suspected of embezzling about $ 5 billion. However, the same law allows for compensation via the courts (ZN, May 2020), which are far from entirely credible independent actors in Ukraine.



Even though the US authorities are investigating Kolomoysky's involvement in financial transactions of dubious origin (ZN, June, 2020), the Ukrainian Prosecutor General's Office shows no interest in taking these cases forward. Instead, new Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova opened multiple criminal cases for "abuse of power" allegedly committed by the former President Petro Poroshenko. As the prosecutor is a well-known loyalist of Zelensky (Hromadske, March 2020), the perception of the prosecutorâ€™s office as politically dependent is gaining more and more traction. There is a striking difference between the â€˜light touchâ€™ approach of the prosecutor's office to the Ukrainian oligarchs who appear in cases of alleged serious bank frauds, on the one hand, and the thorough investigation of Zelensky's political opponents, on the other hand. So far, only a few MEPs from the EU-Ukraine Parliamentary Association Committee have called for a "fair trial" and for a depoliticised investigation against Poroshenko (European Parliament, June 2020).



The obvious politicization (and thus compromising) of the prosecutor's office in Ukraine hardly features on the agenda of EU macro-financial assistance, which in the case of Moldova has repeatedly emphasized the importance of the rule of law. Immediately after the IMF approved the provision of access to $ 5 billion for Ukraine (of which $ 2.1 billion was due for immediate transferred), the EU disbursed the second tranche of the EUR 1 billion in macro-financial assistance of EUR 500 million. Thus there remains a profound lack of consistency in the application of the rule of law by the EU to its eastern neighbors. The liberation of core legal institutions from any political influence, and their subsequent professionalization, should constitute key imperatives for the EUâ€™s cross-sectoral drive for reforms. Instead the EU approach is widely regarded as lacking consistency.



Georgia and European mediation



The EU's image of Georgia is permeated by security emergencies. On the one hand, under Russian control, the separatist regime in South Ossetia moves the borders ("boderization") and perpetuates the violation of Georgian territorial integrity. On the other hand, the Georgian information space is under constant attacks from Russian disinformation networks. Russian policy is aimed at reducing public sympathy for the Euro-Atlantic and European vectors, particularly among the Russian-speaking population. Another subtle (societal-behavioral) and visible (economic) influence takes place through the significant flows of Russian tourists (about 1.4 million people in 2019). The latter will start to return after the reopening of the Georgian borders, increasing the risk of exporting COVID-19 infection from Russia (which currently has more than 530,000 confirmed infections) to Georgia (only 879 confirmed infections).



The stabilization of the political environment is the second element of concern for the European institutions. The EU delegation in Tbilisi (led by Carl Hartzell), together with the US embassy (Kelly Degnan), recently mediated political negotiations between the government led by the "Georgian Dream" and the fractured opposition. During the fifth round of the talks, the political compromise of "March 8" was reached. It advocated the use of proportional voting for the parliamentary elections, scheduled for October 31, 2020. Out of a total of 150 deputies, 120 deputies will be elected under the proportional system, the other 30 MPs coming from uninominal constituencies (Transparency.ge, March 2020). In addition, the electoral threshold for party representation in parliament has been reduced to 1%. Furthermore, government by a single party becomes impossible unless it brings into parliament at least 48 deputies through the proportional vote. In this way, a demonopolization of power is pursued and potentially effected. Since 2013, the real political power in Georgia was concentrated de facto in the hands of oligarch Bidzina Ivanishvili, seen more and more in Washington as a destabilizing factor for good governance and the pro-Western geostrategic orientation of Georgia (Civil.ge, May 2020).



The constitutional and electoral reforms needed to transpose the "March 8 agreement" have gained momentum following the amnesty by the country's president, Salome Zurabishvili, of several political activists and opposition figures- Gigi Ogulava, Irakli Okruashvili. This followed from the ultimatum imposed by the opposition (26 political parties), which conditioned the facilitation of preparations for the introduction of the proportional vote system with the releasing of â€œpolitical prisonersâ€ (RadioFreeEurope, May 2020). However, the amnesty act does not invalidate the fact that the Georgian courts have issued political decisions targeting the opposition in first place (OSW, May 2020).



There is a significant risk that the large number of active political parties and the lowering of electoral barriers could transfer polarization from society to parliament. Even if the electoral process becomes more transparent, fair and free, oligarchic interests can adjust to the new political circumstances. They can try to benefit from natural divisions and political confrontation for the (re-) distribution of political power that will emerge within the newly elected parliament.



The re-democratization of government in Georgia must not become a renewed source of post-2020 political crises. That would shorten the appetite for European integration reforms and restore the political influence of the openly pro-Russian political forces. Although the EU successfully mediated Georgia's latest political crisis, it previously missed the opportunity to robustly apply the conditionality mechanism to oust oligarch Ivanishvili before he moved the country in the direction of "captured state".



Moldova and the political conditionality of the EU



Over the last five years the EU's attitude towards Moldova has been distinguished by its extremely sharp nature and disciplined use of the conditionality mechanism. Neither in Ukraine nor in Georgia did the European partners emphasize the importance of political pre-conditions as intensively and consistent as in the Moldovan case. Nevertheless, that could have made sense given the existing similarities (oligarchs, rule of law irregularities etc.).



Both the European Parliament, through the active participation of Romanian MEPs, and the EU Delegation in Chisinau regularly point out the commitments not fulfilled by the Moldovan authorities. Since 2017, when the agreement on macro-financial assistance was signed and until 2020, three governments have activated. So the incumbent government did not negotiate either the old sectoral conditions or the newly updated political pre-conditions. Therefore, in a slow manner, only the sectoral conditions related to the second tranche (out of a total of three) were fully met. The inflexibility of the political pre-conditions demanded by the EU, combined with the geopolitical preferences for Russia, provokes irritation and infuses with Euroscepticism the rhetoric of the ruling parties in Chisinau, in particular the Socialists (IPN, May 19, 2020).



Out of a total of 8 political conditions addressed by the EU, some are more urgent than others. The opposition and civil society insist on their full implementation before providing financial assistance. The actions of the European side and the opposition create enormous pressure on the government, whose stability is also declining under the impact of political corruption. The recent unanimous adoption in the parliament of the declaration against â€œpolitical tourism and political corruptionâ€ (June 11, 2020) proves the attempt of the â€œassociatesâ€ (a total of 22 deputies - Adrian Candu's group, È˜or Party faction) of the fugitive oligarch Vlad Plahotniuc to stamp their/his influence on developments. The inefficient management of the health crisis, which continuously compresses the economy, puts the government of the Socialists and the Democratic Party (51 deputies) on the brink of political survival. Conditions look gloomy also because, unlike Ukraine and Georgia, the country's leadership does not enjoy significant external support. For instance, the EU treats the government with caution and reluctance. Attempts to obtain external state loans at any cost to cover current budget expenditures also failed, as demonstrated by the cancellation of Russian credit because of constitutional non-compliance (NewEasternEurope, May 2020).



Although Moldova is facing a severe political crisis, against a shaky economic and public health background, the EU shows no determination to use its political authority to contribute to the improvement of the political dialogue in the country. Brussels chooses to be predominantly vocal on political pre-conditions, which it does not do in Ukraine or Georgia. In reality, they can use the recent experience in Georgia to create a platform for negotiations between the government and the opposition to prepare a stable ground for the November 2020 presidential election. The geopolitical pro-Russia core of the governing coalition (Socialists -37 deputies) seemingly discourages the EU from taking a more proactive role.



Waiting for the outcome of the political climax is not a safe strategy, given the ongoing changes in the political composition through corrupt methods. So far, the EU has not shown much desire to participate in the country's political stabilization, as it did in the summer of 2019 when together with the US and Russia, it helped eliminate the oligarchic regime. Conditionality is not a strategy, but a useful tool, if coupled with other actions. The EU can act based on independent political calculations. They must reflect the agendas of its political allies in Moldova, but in all circumstance, it should avoid any form of bias in its approaches.



Instead of conclusions...



Even if changes throughout the Eastern Partnership matter, European integration in the partner countries is a priority, as they will have a multiplier effect on the rest of the region, including Russia. Therefore, the focus on the rule of law, especially on depoliticization of law enforcement agencies, has equal significance in Ukraine and Georgia, as well as in Moldova. The EU can use its own experience in the three countries to translate policies and policies that have proven effective, and where they fit better.



The issue of oligarchs in the region is little emphasized on the EU's political agenda. This is noticeable when compared to US equities. Unlike Europeans, they investigate the origin of the financial transactions of Ukrainian oligarchs and the impact of the influence of the oligarchic system on foreign investment in Georgia. In its eastern neighborhood, the EU has a beneficial political context to cooperate with allied forces to complement and excel the reform efforts.

Dionis CenuÅŸa, Senior Contributor Dionis CenuÅŸa, Senior Contributor

Areas of research: European Neighborhood Policy, EU-Moldova relationship, EU's foreign policy and Russia, migration and energy security.

Follow Dionis CenuÈ™a on Dionis CenuÈ™a is a political scientist, researcher at the Institute of Political Sciences at Liebig-Justus University in Giessen, Germany, MA degree in Interdisciplinary European Studies from the College of Europe in Warsaw.Areas of research: European Neighborhood Policy, EU-Moldova relationship, EU's foreign policy and Russia, migration and energy security.Follow Dionis CenuÈ™a on Twitter

Dionis CenuÈ™a

Or, Bruxelles-ul a reacÈ›ionat altfel (foarte dur) atunci cÃ¢nd guvernul reformator, condus de Maia Sandu, a cÄƒzut Ã®n Moldova (NewEasternEurope, 29 Noiembrie 2020). Chiar dacÄƒ autoritÄƒÈ›ile americane investigheazÄƒ implicarea lui Kolomoysky Ã®n tranzacÈ›ii de bani de provenienÈ›Äƒ dubioasÄƒ (ZN, 5 Iunie 2020), Procuratura GeneralÄƒ ucraineanÄƒ nu aratÄƒ niciun interes. Ãn schimb, procurorul general Iryna Venediktova a deschis multiple dosare penale pentru â€œabuz de putereâ€ pe numele ex-preÈ™edintelui Petro Poroshenko. RÄƒmÃ¢ne Ã®n ceaÈ›a diferenÈ›a de abordare a procuraturii ucrainene faÈ›Äƒ de acÈ›iunile oligarhilor ucraineni, care figureazÄƒ Ã®n furtul bancar È™i, respectiv, investigarea minuÈ›ioasÄƒ faÈ›Äƒ de oponenÈ›ii politici ai lui Zelensky. DeocamdatÄƒ, doar cÃ¢È›iva europarlamentari, din partea Comitetului Parlamentar de Asociere UE-Ucraina, au cerut un â€œproces echitabilâ€ È™i asigurare unei investigaÈ›ii depolitizate Ã®mpotriva lui Poroshenko (Parlamentul European, iunie 2020).



Politizarea vÄƒditÄƒ a Procuraturii nu a figurat nicidecum pe agenda asistenÈ›ei macro-financiare a UE, care Ã®n cazul Moldovei repetitiv accentueazÄƒ importanÈ›a statului de drept. ÃndatÄƒ dupÄƒ ce FMI a aprobat oferirea accesului la 5 miliarde USD pentru Ucraina (dintre care 2,1 miliarde USD transferate imediat), UE a debursat a doua tranÈ™Äƒ din asistenÈ›Äƒ macrofinanciarÄƒ de 1 miliard EUR, Ã®n valoare de 500 milioane EUR. TotuÈ™i, UE urmeazÄƒ sÄƒ demonstreze coerenÈ›Äƒ Ã®n aplicarea pre-condiÈ›iilor politice, centratÄƒ pe statul de drept, Ã®n mod identic, faÈ›Äƒ toÈ›i vecinii sÄƒi estici. Eliberarea instituÈ›iilor de drept de sub orice influenÈ›Äƒ politicÄƒ È™i ulterioara lor profesionalizare sunt lucruri imperative pentru impulsionarea inter-sectorialÄƒ a reformelor.



Georgia È™i medierea europeanÄƒ



Imaginea UE despre Georgia este pÄƒtrunsÄƒ de urgenÈ›ele de securitate. Pe de o parte, sub controlul Rusiei, regimul separatist din Osetia de Sud miÈ™cÄƒ frontierele (â€œborderizationâ€) È™i perpetueazÄƒ Ã®ncÄƒlcarea integritÄƒÈ›ii teritoriale georgiene. Pe de altÄƒ parte, spaÈ›iul informaÈ›ional georgian se aflÄƒ sub lovitura constantÄƒ a dezinformÄƒrii ruseÈ™ti. Obiectivul acestora pare sÄƒ fie diminuarea simpatiilor publice faÈ›Äƒ de vectorul euro-atlantic È™i cel european, Ã®n particular Ã®n rÃ¢ndul populaÈ›iei care posedÄƒ limba rusÄƒ. AltÄƒ influenÈ›Äƒ subtilÄƒ (societal-comportamentalÄƒ) È™i vizibilÄƒ (economicÄƒ) are loc prin intermediul fluxurilor de turiÈ™ti ruÈ™i (circa 1,4 milioane de persoane Ã®n 2019). Cei din urmÄƒ vor reveni dupÄƒ redeschiderea frontierelor georgiene, sporind riscul de export a infecÈ›iei COVID-19 din Rusia spre Georgia.



Stabilizarea mediului politic constituie al doilea bloc de preocupÄƒri al instituÈ›iilor europene. DelegaÈ›ia UE de la Tbilisi (Carl Hartzell), Ã®mpreunÄƒ cu ambasada SUA (Kelly Degnan), au mediat negocierile politice dintre guvernarea condusÄƒ de â€œVisul Georgianâ€ È™i opoziÈ›ie. Ãn decursul celei de-a cincea runde de negocieri, a fost atins compromisul politic din â€œ8 martieâ€ ce vizeazÄƒ valorificarea votului proporÈ›ional pentru alegerile parlamentare din 31 octombrie 2020. AÈ™adar, din totalul de 150 deputaÈ›i, Ã®n baza votului proporÈ›ional vor fi aleÈ™i 120 deputaÈ›i, ceilalÈ›i 30 vor fi votaÈ›i Ã®n circumscripÈ›ii uninominale (Transparency.ge, 10 Martie 2020). De asemenea, a fost redus pragul electoral pÃ¢nÄƒ la 1%, iar guvernarea de cÄƒtre un singur partid devine imposibilÄƒ decÃ¢t dacÄƒ acesta aduce Ã®n Parlament minim 48 deputaÈ›i cu votul proporÈ›ional. Ãn acest fel, se doreÈ™te o demonopolizare a puterii, care din 2013 este concentratÄƒ de facto Ã®n mÃ¢inile oligarhului Bidzina Ivanishvili, vÄƒzut tot mai mult, Ã®n Washington, drept factor destabilizator pentru buna guvernare È™i orientarea geostrategicÄƒ pro-occidentalÄƒ a Georgiei (Civil.ge, Mai 2020).



Reformele constituÈ›ionalÄƒ È™i electoralÄƒ necesare pentru transpunerea â€œacordului din 8 martieâ€ au cÄƒpÄƒtat puls dupÄƒ amnistierea de cÄƒtre preÈ™edintele È›Äƒrii, Salome Zurabishvili, a mai multor activiÈ™ti politici â€“ Gigi Ogulava, Irakli Okruashvili. Aceasta a rezultat din ultimatumul impus de opoziÈ›ie (26 partide politice), care a condiÈ›ionat facilitarea pregÄƒtirilor pentru introducerea votului proporÈ›ional cu eliberarea â€œprizonierilor politiciâ€ (RadioFreeEurope, Mai 2020). Actorii pro-europeni din Ucraina, Georgia È™i Moldova necesitÄƒ sprijinul UE, deoarece aceÈ™tia sunt relevanÈ›i È™i indivizibili pentru desfÄƒÈ™urarea reformelor. Acest lucru este È™tiut bine de Rusia, care cÃ¢È™tigÄƒ, fÄƒrÄƒ intervenÈ›ie, din eÈ™ecul reformelor, provocate de crizele politice repetitive. Din acest considerent, UE trebuie sÄƒ-È™i pregÄƒteascÄƒ arsenalul diplomatic pentru gestionarea pro-activÄƒ a crizelor politice est-eurpene, avÃ¢nd la temelia acÈ›iunilor calcule strategice, nu temporare.

Incapacitatea lui PoroÈ™enko de a combate corupÈ›ia este principalul motiv al nepopularitÄƒÈ›ii sale, care Ã®i determinÄƒ pe ucraineni sÄƒ treacÄƒ cu vederea contribuÈ›ia sa Ã®n demararea unei â€europenizÄƒriâ€ fÄƒrÄƒ precedent a Ucrainei. O asemenea evoluÈ›ie ar putea Ã®nsÄƒ extinde izolarea Moldovei, cel puÈ›in Ã®n raport cu vecinii, de la preÈ™edinÈ›ie cÄƒtre celelalte instituÈ›ii centrale.

ÃncercÄƒrile lui Igor Dodon de a prolifera o imagine pozitivÄƒ a Rusiei Ã®n Moldova constituie o anomalie pentru È›Äƒrile semnatare ale Acordurilor de Asociere cu UE. Dar, Ã®n politica moldoveneascÄƒ, loialitatea faÈ›Äƒ de un anumit vector geopolitic este relativizatÄƒ È™i puternic tranzacÈ›ionatÄƒ Ã®n scopuri politico-electorale. Evident, modificÄƒrile constituÈ›ionale propulsate de Petr PoroÈ™enko Ã®mpiedicÄƒ pe oricine vine dupÄƒ el sÄƒ facÄƒ orice schimbÄƒri radicale de politica externÄƒ. Acesta reprezintÄƒ minimul pe care urmaÈ™ul lui PoroÈ™enko, dacÄƒ nu el Ã®nÈ™iÈ™i, va trebui sÄƒ-l Ã®ndeplineascÄƒ, obiectul maxim fiind contracararea corupÈ›iei.

Asimilarea sau chiar naÈ›ionalizarea â€œActului Magntiskyâ€ poate fi transformatÄƒ Ã®ntr-o (pre)condiÈ›ie politicÄƒ pentru acordarea sprijinului financiar Ã®n È›Äƒrile unde SUA È™i UE susÈ›in reforme democratice...



Dionis CenuÈ™a

Se contureazÄƒ o serie de condiÈ›ii necesare pentru a pune bazele unor instrumente occidentale noi de imobilizare a oligarhilor È™i a altor infractori severi ai statului de drept din lume. Acest lucru ar putea sÄƒ ajute la vindecarea guvernanÈ›ei Ã®n Europa de Est.



Legislatorii americani au Ã®nceput sÄƒ zideascÄƒ mÄƒsurile de combatere a cleptocraÈ›iei din Rusia È™i din restul lumii, denumite CROOK (CSCE, Ianuarie 2020), care va completa â€œActul lui Magnitskyâ€, adoptat de SUA Ã®n 2012 È™i extins faÈ›Äƒ alte È›Äƒri decÃ¢t Rusia Ã®n 2017 (Departamentul de Stat, Decembrie 2017). Iar, pe celÄƒlalt mal al Atlanticului, decidenÈ›ii politici din statele Uniunii Europene (UE), Ã®n frunte cu noua Comisie EuropeanÄƒ, au convenit asupra creÄƒrii unui mecanism de sancÈ›ionare, similar cu cel american, Ã®n 2020 (EuroActiv, 10 Decembrie 2019). Prin urmare, È™i Ã®n pofida disensiunilor din alte domenii, partenerii transatlantici valoreazÄƒ Ã®n aceeaÈ™i mÄƒsurÄƒ statul de drept. TotuÈ™i, sancÈ›ionarea cleptocraÈ›iei globale este tratatÄƒ ca pe un obiectiv al securitÄƒÈ›i naÈ›ionale de cÄƒtre SUA, Ã®n timp ce UE vede Ã®n acest lucru o Ã®ndeplinire a misiunii de promotor al drepturilor omului.



PÃ¢nÄƒ cÃ¢nd UE intrÄƒ Ã®n posesia propriului mecanism de sancÈ›ionare dedicat apÄƒrÄƒrii drepturilor omului, Moldova, Georgia È™i Ucraina ar fi putut conceptualiza Ã®mpreunÄƒ un â€œAct Magnitskyâ€ pentru regiunea ZLSAC. Ãn prezent, acest obiectiv este Ã®nsÄƒ irealizabil. PreÈ™edinÈ›ia ucraineanÄƒ priveÈ™te selectiv oligarhia localÄƒ È™i este discreditatÄƒ de traficul de influenÈ›Äƒ, atribuitÄƒ unor diverÈ™i exponenÈ›i ai administraÈ›iei Casei Albe. Moldova È™i Georgia sunt de asemenea irelevante. Prima graviteazÄƒ Ã®n jurul cercurilor oligarhice ruseÈ™ti, iar a doua se confruntÄƒ cu un sistem oligarhic care foloseÈ™te tactici autoritare pentru a descuraja manifestÄƒrile democratice.



â€œActul Magnitskyâ€ È™i alte sancÈ›iuni Ã®n acÈ›iune



Ãn regiunea Parteneriatului Estic, primele sancÈ›iuni individuale aplicate de cÄƒtre SUA È™i UE au fost Ã®mpotriva exponenÈ›ilor regimului autocratic condus de cÄƒtre Alexandr LukaÈ™enko. DupÄƒ cÄƒderea regimului oligarhic din Ucraina Ã®n 2014 È™i ingerinÈ›ele politico-militare ale Rusiei Ã®n afacerile interne ucrainene Ã®n Crimeea È™i regiunea Donbas, sancÈ›iunile individuale americane (4 decizii â€“ 219 persoane, 463 entitÄƒÈ›i) È™i europene (177 persoane, 44 entitÄƒÈ›i) au vizat ex-oficiali ucraineni, exponenÈ›i ai separatismului paramilitar È™i decidenÈ›i din anturajul lui Vladimir Putin. Unele sancÈ›iuni europene individuale aplicate faÈ›Äƒ de ex-preÈ™edintele ucrainean Viktor Yanukovych sunt parÈ›ial anulate prin intermediul justiÈ›iei europene (112.ua, Septembrie 2019).



TotodatÄƒ, transpunerea â€œActului Magnitskyâ€ a cuprins persoane nu doar din Rusia, dar È™i din cercurile de guvernare actuale È™i trecute din alte È›Äƒri CSI, dar È™i din UE. Ãn decembrie 2017, Ã®n lista sancÈ›iunilor individuale au fost incluÈ™i (Treasury.gov, Decembrie 2017): Gulnara Karimova, fiica fostului preÈ™edinte uzbek Islam Karimov È™i Artem Chayka, fiul fostului procuror general al Rusiei È™i fratele lui Igor Chayka, care are afaceri (in)directe cu familia preÈ™edintelui moldovean Igor Dodon Ã®n Rusia (BalkanInsight, Iulie 2019) È™i Moldova (ZDG, Decembrie 2019). Ãn perioada anilor 2017-2019, lista neagrÄƒ a fost completatÄƒ cu persoane controversate din statele UE, precum È™i din È›Äƒri candidate spre aderare la UE (Vezi Tabelul de mai jos).

Artem Chayka, fiul fostului procuror general al Rusiei Rusia 3. Serghey Kusiuk, comandat din cadrul â€œBerkutâ€, care a aplicat violenÈ›a Ã®mpotriva protestatarilor paÈ™nici Ã®n Noiembrie 2013. Ucraina 4. Slobodan Tesic, implicat Ã®n trafic ilegal cu arme de foc Ã®n Balcani È™i Ã®n Nordul Africii (Libia). Serbia 10 Dec. 2019 5. Goran Andric È™i 7 alÈ›i asociaÈ›i ai acestuia, implicaÈ›i Ã®n vÃ¢nzÄƒri ilegale de arme de foc, participanÈ›i Ã®n afacerile lui Slobodan Tesic. Serbia

LÄƒrgirea criteriilor de eligibilitate pentru activarea mai frecventÄƒ a â€œActului Magnitskyâ€ È™i cuplarea acestuia cu iniÈ›iative de tipul CROOK de cÄƒtre SUA, Ã®mpreunÄƒ cu replicarea lor Ã®n interiorul UE, ar È™tirbi enorm din interesul oligarhilor de a captura sau corupe puterea politicÄƒ Ã®n aÈ™a È›Äƒri ca Moldova, Georgia sau Ucraina. Ãn rezultat, oligarhii din regiune vor fi forÈ›aÈ›i sÄƒ-È™i corecteze conduita È™i sÄƒ intre Ã®n legalitate, Ã®n paralel renunÈ›Ã¢nd la practici ce degradeazÄƒ proprietatea publicÄƒ È™i bruscheazÄƒ drepturile omului.



Moldova - doar Plahotniuc?



InterdicÈ›ia de vizÄƒ Ã®mpotriva oligarhului fugar Vladimir Plahotniuc (US State Department, Ianuarie 2020), introdusÄƒ de cÄƒtre SUA Ã®n 2020, constituie o reacÈ›ie necesarÄƒ faÈ›Äƒ de acÈ›iunile exponentului cheie a regimului oligarhic, care a abuzat instituÈ›iile democratice din Moldova, cu precÄƒdere Ã®n anii 2015-2019 (IPN, May 2017). Conform investigaÈ›iilor jurnalistice, Plahotniuc se aflÄƒ Ã®n posesia unei categorii de vize avansate (E-2), solicitatÄƒ Ã®n schimbul unor investiÈ›ii semnificative, Ã®n mod precipitat, dupÄƒ alegerile parlamentare din 2019 (Anticoruptie.md, Ianuarie 2020). Atunci coaliÈ›ia de guvernare dintre blocul ACUM È™i SocialiÈ™ti a prins rÄƒdÄƒcini, iar Plahotniuc a decis auto-dizolvarea regimului oligarhic (3DCFTAs, June 2019), pentru a evita sancÈ›iuni individuale.



Imobilizarea fizicÄƒ a oligarhului, prin sancÈ›iunile individuale parÈ›iale ale SUA, este Ã®nsÄƒ insuficientÄƒ. Blocarea bunurilor imobiliare È™i celor financiare, deÈ›inute cel puÈ›in pe teritoriul american, trebuie incluse pentru actele de corupÈ›ie (contribuÈ›ia la â€furtul miliarduluiâ€) Ã®n baza prevederilor â€Actului Magnitskyâ€. Un alt pas logic È™i imperativ ar constitui extinderea sancÈ›iunilor cel puÈ›in cÄƒtre Ilan Shor, actualmente adÄƒpostit Ã®n Israel, datoritÄƒ dublei cetÄƒÈ›enii.



NaÈ›ionalizarea â€œActului Magnitskyâ€ È™i transpunerea acestuia Ã®n cadrul normativ naÈ›ional a fost sugeratÄƒ Ã®n 2018 (IPN, Decemberie 2018), dar s-a pierdut Ã®n negocierile ACUM-PSRM de formare a coaliÈ›iei. MenÈ›iunea â€œActului Magnitskyâ€ a lipsit din acordurile PSRM-ACUM, cel iniÈ›ial din luna iunie (Acordul PSRM-ACUM-1) È™i respectiv din septembrie 2019 (Acordul ACUM-PSRM-2). Acest lucru a provocat o abatere majorÄƒ de la promisiunile electorale ale Blocului ACUM (Programul electoral ACUM, Februarie 2019). De abia Ã®n ianuarie 2020, cÃ¢teva luni dupÄƒ demiterea guvernului Maiei Sandu (NEE, Noiembrie 2019) È™i pÄƒrÄƒsirea de cÄƒtre ACUM a guvernÄƒrii, Platforma DA a revenit la demersul privind necesitatea adoptÄƒrii â€œlegii Magnitskyâ€ (Ianuarie 2020).



Astfel, s-au scurs practic 2 ani din momentul cÃ¢nd Partidul Liberal Democrat a propus un asemenea proiect de lege (Ã®n iulie 2018), aflat Ã®n opoziÈ›ie parlamentarÄƒ (IPN, Decembrie 2018). O explicaÈ›ie a eÈ™ecului blocului ACUM de a pune Ã®n vigoare â€œlegea Magnitskyâ€ constituie compromisul geopolitic cu PSRM. A existat o intenÈ›ie generalÄƒ, asumatÄƒ plenar de componentele coaliÈ›iei, privind restabilirea relaÈ›iilor cu Estul È™i Vestul pentru a menÈ›ine stabilitatea politicÄƒ È™i economicÄƒ a È›Äƒrii (IPN, Septembrie 2019).



Viitoarea È™ansÄƒ de a adopta â€œlegea Magnitskyâ€, deÈ™i Ã®ndepÄƒrtatÄƒ, va apÄƒrea dupÄƒ È™i dacÄƒ opoziÈ›ia pro-UE va fi capabilÄƒ sÄƒ-i Ã®nlÄƒture pe SocialiÈ™ti de la putere. Alegerile prezidenÈ›iale din 2020 constituie o primÄƒ â€œfereastrÄƒ de oportunitateâ€.



Oligarhii intangibili din Georgia È™i Ucraina



Comparabil cu Vladimir Plahotniuc, oligarhul Bidzina Ivanishvili a adus Georgia Ã®n pragul â€œstatului capturatâ€. OpoziÈ›ia politicÄƒ se simte ameninÈ›atÄƒ de justiÈ›ie selectivÄƒ (Civil.ge, Martie 2019), iar detenÈ›iile administrative È™i aplicarea de amenzi disproporÈ›ionate (300-750 EUR), Ã®mpotriva protestelor din iunie 2019, Ã®ncalcÄƒ drepturile fundamentale (Transparency.ge, Ianuarie 2019). ÃngrijorÄƒri serioase legate de regresele democratice, cu efecte negative asupra investiÈ›iilor americane, sunt adresate de cÄƒtre SUA, pe linie bipartizanÄƒ, cÄƒtre â€œVisul Georgianâ€, controlat de Ivanishvili (Civil.ge, Ianuarie 2020). UE a venit deocamdatÄƒ cu remarci atente vizavi de reformele din domeniul electoral È™i cel al justiÈ›iei (EEAS, Decembrie 2019). Ãn niciun fel, UE nu vrea sÄƒ confrunte factorul oligarhic care deformeazÄƒ buna guvernare din Georgia, semnalÃ¢nd cÄƒ prioritizeazÄƒ stabilitatea È™i securitatea fragilÄƒ.



Ucraina este un alt exemplu de compromis parÈ›ial cu factorul oligarhic. DeÈ™i activitatea ex-preÈ™edintelui Petr PoroÈ™enko este pe larg investigatÄƒ Ã®n peste 10 dosare (UNIAN, iulie 2019), statul ucrainean permite consolidarea poziÈ›iei oligarhului Igor Kolomoisky. Cel din urmÄƒ intimideazÄƒ instituÈ›ii de stat (Banca NaÈ›ionalÄƒ) È™i face presiuni pentru a-È™i restabili drepturile asupra bÄƒncii â€Privatbankâ€, naÈ›ionalizatÄƒ Ã®n 2016 dupÄƒ devalizÄƒri sistemice Ã®n valoare de 5,5 miliarde USD (OCCRP, Ianuarie 2018). AdministraÈ›ia lui Volodymyr Zelensky este pregÄƒtitÄƒ sÄƒ facÄƒ cedÄƒri cÄƒtre Kolomoisky, care vor fi cruciale pentru viitorul relaÈ›iilor cu FMI (Ukrinform, Septembrie 2019). Prin decizia CurÈ›ii de la Londra din octombrie 2019 a fost refuzatÄƒ deblocarea activelor Ã®ngheÈ›ate Ã®n 2017 ce aparÈ›in lui Kolomoisky (EuroActiv, Octombrie 2019). Acest precedent va pune Ã®n luminÄƒ negativÄƒ instanÈ›ele ucrainene, dacÄƒ acestea vor favoriza demersurile oligarhului ucrainean (Antac, Decembrie 2019).



Cazul ucrainean, dar È™i mai mult cel georgian, denotÄƒ un potenÈ›ial enorm pentru aplicarea â€Actului Magnitskyâ€ de cÄƒtre SUA È™i ulterior de UE, cu propriul mecanism. OpoziÈ›ia È™i societatea civilÄƒ din aceste È›Äƒri pot populariza aceastÄƒ idee, inclusiv ca obiectiv pentru modernizarea legislaÈ›iei naÈ›ionale Ã®n vederea imunizÄƒrii Ã®mpotriva influenÈ›elor cleptocratice din regiune (Rusia, Azerbaijan, Turcia sau chiar din È›Äƒrile UE â€“ Ungaria etc.).



Ãn loc de concluzii...



MÄƒsurile extra-teritoriale stabilite de cÄƒtre Occident È›intesc persoane È™i entitÄƒÈ›i, care recurg la acte de corupÈ›ie, degradante pentru statul de drept È™i situaÈ›ia drepturilor omului pentru grupuri sociale largi. Pentru state cu instituÈ›ii È™i democraÈ›ie precare, intervenÈ›iile occidentale au efect salvator, deÈ™i parÈ›ial. Or, din cauza caracterului tardiv, sancÈ›iunile nu reuÈ™esc sÄƒ joace un rol demotivant pentru â€œinfractoriiâ€ Ã®n devenire.



Este cert faptul cÄƒ protecÈ›ia valorilor democratice de tip occidental, prin introducerea unor sancÈ›iuni individuale, are potenÈ›ialul de a genera constrÃ¢ngeri Ã®mpotriva guvernanÈ›ilor cu trÄƒsÄƒturi autoritare sau cu angajamente oligarhice din È›Äƒrile asociate cu UE. Asimilarea sau chiar naÈ›ionalizarea â€œActului Magntiskyâ€ poate fi transformatÄƒ Ã®ntr-o (pre)condiÈ›ie politicÄƒ pentru acordarea sprijinului financiar Ã®n È›Äƒrile unde SUA È™i UE susÈ›in reforme democratice.

Ãn materie politicÄƒ, regimul lui Vladimir Putin denotÄƒ rezilienÈ›Äƒ, eliminÃ¢nd Ã®n continuare adversarii care Ã®i contestÄƒ legitimitatea Ã®n limitele frontierelor naÈ›ionale. Tot Ã®n materie politicÄƒ, dar din perspectiva ucraineanÄƒ, costurile È™i riscurile ridicate pentru organizarea alegerilor prezidenÈ›iale È™i parlamentare Ã®n 2024, cauzate de rÄƒzboi, ar putea determina Kievul sÄƒ-È™i menÈ›inÄƒ actuala garniturÄƒ politicÄƒ. DeÈ™i Tiraspolul a acuzat partea ucraineanÄƒ, nu Rusia, serviciile secrete ale celei din urmÄƒ au fost identificate drept presupuÈ™i autori ai acÈ›iunilor subversive (Riddle, Mai 2022). Din acestea raÈ›ionamente, pentru a-È™i asigura propria supravieÈ›uire, elitele transnistrene nu vor abandona poziÈ›iile pro-ruse cÃ¢t timp Rusia nu este Ã®n mod ireversibil pe poziÈ›ii perdante Ã®n Ucraina. PÃ¢nÄƒ atunci actorii politici din regiunea transnistreanÄƒ vor evita sÄƒ se disocieze de interesele geopolitice ruseÈ™ti.



Dilemele regiunii transnistrene

Aceste douÄƒ direcÈ›ii de gÃ¢ndire determinÄƒ dilema cu care se confruntÄƒ cei care controleazÄƒ de facto procesele politice din regiunea transnistreanÄƒ.

De aceea, ambele pÄƒrÈ›i sunt cointeresate sÄƒ elimine prezenÈ›a politico-militarÄƒ rusÄƒ din regiunea transnistreanÄƒ, cel mai degrabÄƒ imediat dupÄƒ terminarea rÄƒzboiului È™i dacÄƒ Ucraina obÈ›ine victorie. Ãn asemenea caz, Rusia ar putea sÄƒ cearÄƒ concesii legate de restabilirea tranzitului unitÄƒÈ›ilor militare ruse prin Ucraina, posibilÄƒ anterior Ã®n baza acordului din 1998, anulat Ã®n 2015, pentru a scoate regiunea transnistreanÄƒ din izolare. DeÈ™i condiÈ›iile anterioare sunt neideale pentru elitele separatiste, acestea ar oferi un teren de manevrÄƒ mai convenabil Ã®n raport cu autoritÄƒÈ›ile constituÈ›ionale de la ChiÈ™inÄƒu.



Pe de altÄƒ parte, Ã®n timp de doi ani, avantajul energetic al Tiraspolului Ã®n negocieri cu malul drept va pierde semnificativ din pondere ca urmare a aprofundÄƒrii interconectÄƒrii energetice a Moldovei cu RomÃ¢nia. De asemenea, cu pierderea veniturilor din producÈ›ia de energie pe bazÄƒ de gaz rusesc neachitat, elitele din regiune ar putea fi impuse sÄƒ readucÄƒ parÈ›ial È™i gradual economia regiunii Ã®n cÃ¢mpul legal al Moldovei. Probabilitatea unor asemenea evoluÈ›ii este Ã®naltÄƒ, mai ales dacÄƒ Rusia eÈ™ueazÄƒ sÄƒ forÈ›eze o pace asupra Ucrainei. Altfel, acestea vor trebui sÄƒ iniÈ›ieze o confruntare, care, din cauza slÄƒbirii Rusiei, ar putea fi Ã®n van. AvÃ¢nd Ã®n vedere capacitÄƒÈ›ile sale militare È™i operaÈ›ionale, Ucraina nu va ezita sÄƒ reacÈ›ioneze la orice risc militar venit din regiunea separatistÄƒ.

Regimul separatist de la Tiraspol Ã®ncÄƒ Ã®È™i poate folosi pÃ¢rghia energeticÄƒ pentru a extrage anumite concesii de ordin comercial de la ChiÈ™inÄƒu, inclusiv cu permisiunea instituÈ›iilor UE. 1. Status-quo-ul neschimbat â€“ â€rÄƒul cel mai micâ€ pentru Moldova È™i UE. Mecanismul de descurajare a unei eventuale agresiuni din partea regiunii transnistrene trebuie sÄƒ reiasÄƒ dintr-un set de mÄƒsuri de prevenire a riscurilor strategice. Reducerea sau chiar eliminarea completÄƒ a riscurilor economice poate fi realizatÄƒ prin stabilirea unor alternative de transport, energetice etc. Ãn domeniul securitÄƒÈ›ii, afiÈ™area costurilor pentru escaladarea transnistreanÄƒ va depinde de consolidarea capacitÄƒÈ›ilor instituÈ›ionale ale organelor de forÈ›Äƒ È™i a armatei. Luate Ã®mpreunÄƒ, acestea pot produce o situaÈ›ie Ã®n care status-quo-ul actual poate fi menÈ›inut pentru a creÈ™te puterea de negociere a ChiÈ™inÄƒului.



2. Schimbarea parametrilor de negocieri â€“ â€factorul ucraineanâ€. Kievul demonstreazÄƒ interes strategic faÈ›Äƒ de contribuirea la soluÈ›ionarea conflictului transnistrean, pe cale politicÄƒ. OdatÄƒ ce agresiunea militarÄƒ rusÄƒ este luatÄƒ sub control È™i decimatÄƒ prin de-ocuparea teritoriilor, obiectivul ucrainean va deveni eliminarea ameninÈ›Äƒrilor emanate din regiunea separatistÄƒ din Moldova. Potrivit acestui scenariu, motorul soluÈ›ionÄƒrii conflictului transnistrean poate deveni factorul ucrainean, mai mult decÃ¢t cel moldovenesc. DacÄƒ Ucraina Ã®nfrÃ¢nge Rusia, atunci influenÈ›a geopoliticÄƒ rusÄƒ asupra regiunii va decÄƒdea de la sine, iar elitele transnistrene vor acÈ›iona pragmatic Ã®n favoarea antrenÄƒrii Ã®ntr-un dialog constructiv cu ChiÈ™inÄƒul pentru a evita riscuri de ordin ucrainean. Ãn practicÄƒ, ChiÈ™inÄƒul va juca rolul â€œpoliÈ›istului bunâ€, iar Ucraina va fi perceputÄƒ la Tiraspol volens nolens drept â€œpoliÈ›istul rÄƒuâ€.



3. Escaladarea conflictului â€“ â€œfactorul rusescâ€. Scenariul cu riscuri majore È›ine de eventuala intenÈ›ie a Rusiei de a dezgheÈ›a conflictul Ã®ntr-o formÄƒ sau alta. Costuri majore pentru Moldova È™i Ucraina pot fi generate prin intermediul sabotÄƒrii depozitului de armament vechi din regiunea transnistreanÄƒ (Cobasna) sau chiar È›intirea cu rachete, invocÃ¢nd necesitatea apÄƒrÄƒrii pacificatorilor sau a cetÄƒÈ›enilor sÄƒi. Exemplul ucrainean demonstreazÄƒ cÄƒ Rusia este capabilÄƒ sÄƒ Ã®ncalce orice â€œlinii roÈ™iiâ€, iar Moldova nu are capacitÄƒÈ›i anti-aeriene de identificare È™i detectare a rachetelor ruseÈ™ti. Un asemenea scenariu va Ã®nsemna cel mai degrabÄƒ pierderea atractivitÄƒÈ›ii culturale a Rusiei Ã®n regiunea transnistreanÄƒ, similar schimbÄƒrii radicale de atitudine observatÄƒ Ã®n regiunile tradiÈ›ionale pro-ruse din Ucraina, precum Odesa.



Ãn loc de concluzii...



O precondiÈ›ie care sÄƒ Ã®ncline regiunea transnistreanÄƒ spre un dialog necondiÈ›ionat va reieÈ™i din calitatea implementÄƒrii agendei europene de cÄƒtre autoritÄƒÈ›ile constituÈ›ionale. TotodatÄƒ, UE va trebui sÄƒ-È™i asume cheltuieli legate de o eventualÄƒ crizÄƒ energeticÄƒ Ã®n regiunea separatistÄƒ, provocatÄƒ de sistarea livrÄƒrii de gaze naturale. Nu Ã®n ultimul rÃ¢nd, conteazÄƒ voinÈ›a Kievului de a susÈ›ine strategiile de reintegrare a Moldovei, pe care cea din urmÄƒ trebuie sÄƒ le revizuiascÄƒ reieÈ™ind din setul de scenarii plauzibile privind evoluÈ›ia situaÈ›iei din Ucraina, dar È™i probabilitÄƒÈ›ile dezgheÈ›Äƒrii, deliberate, a conflictului transnistrean de cÄƒtre Moscova Ã®ntr-o â€operaÈ›iune de uzurÄƒâ€ Ã®mpotriva Moldovei È™i a frontierei sud-vestice a Ucrainei.

Source title: Biden, Pentagon, NATO signal readiness to go to war against Russia over Ukraine â€“ Anti-bellum
title: Biden, Pentagon, NATO signal readiness to go to war against Russia over Ukraine
text:
Biden, Pentagon, NATO signal readiness to go to war against Russia over Ukraine

Rick Rozoff

Recent press releases from the White House, the Defense Department and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization uniformly communicate the message that the U.S. and NATO are willing, and perhaps are preparing, to enter into armed conflict with Russia over their joint client regime in Ukraine.

On April 1 U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin held a phone conversation with his Ukrainian counterpart, Defense Minister Andrii Taran, in which he â€œreaffirmed unwavering U.S. support for Ukraineâ€™s sovereignty, territorial integrity, and Euro-Atlantic aspirations.â€ The last expression means joining NATO, first, and the European Union, second (as has occurred with all thirteen NATO members inducted since 1999 that also joined the EU.) In the words of the Pentagonâ€™s readout of the conversation, Austin also â€œcondemned recent escalations of Russian aggressive and provocative actions in eastern Ukraineâ€¦.â€ The defense chief also â€œreiterated the U.S. commitment to building the capacity of Ukraineâ€™s forces to defend more effectively against Russian aggression.â€

Austin recalled that the U.S. has provided Ukraine with over $2 billion in military and security assistance since the American-engineered violent uprising in the nation seven years ago that resulted in the ouster of the legally-elected and internationally-recognized government of Viktor Yanukovych and war in the Donbas region. Austin also confirmed a recent $125 million package from the Pentagon to â€œenhance the lethality, command and control, and situational awareness of Ukraineâ€™s Armed Forces.â€

When the head of the mightiest military organization in the world, one which outspends Russia on defense more than ten times, speaks of a key political and military client regime â€“ and one in a nation moreover that has enriched the family of the current U.S. president â€“ as the victim of military aggression, the inevitable corollaries of his pronouncement are not hard to divine.

The following day President Joe Biden (or so it was reported) spoke with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and â€œaffirmed the United Statesâ€™ unwavering support for Ukraineâ€™s sovereignty and territorial integrity in the face of Russiaâ€™s ongoing aggression in the Donbas and Crimea.â€ Biden reportedly spoke of intensifying the strategic partnership between the two states and spoke of reforms â€“ to repeat, Biden spoke of reforms in Ukraine â€“ that are â€œcentral to Ukraineâ€™s Euro-Atlantic aspirations.â€ That is, to becoming a full member of NATO.

The same day Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba called for an â€œurgent American involvement in the de-occupation of (Donbas) and Crimeaâ€ in a newspaper interview.

On April 1 NATO itself joined the chorus of Western denunciations of Russia, with an alliance official stating, â€œRussiaâ€™s destabilising actions undermine efforts to de-escalate tensions,â€ in the Donbas, adding, â€œAllies shared their concerns about Russiaâ€™s recent large scale military activities in and around Ukraine.â€ The â€œin Ukraineâ€ reference was no doubt concerning Crimea, and the â€œaround Ukraineâ€ one relating to Russian troop movements within Russia itself. Given the fact that the Ukrainian government has been waging war for seven years in Donetsk and Lugansk, which border Russia, and that Russian citizens have been killed and wounded by Ukrainian shelling across the border into Russia, would seem to justify Russian troop movements given the recent escalation of hostilities in the region.

U.S. European Command (EUCOM) has raised its alert status to the highest level. EUCOM is one of six geographical unified (Army, Marine Corps, Navy, Air Force, Space Force and Coast Guard) combatant commands the Pentagon employs to divide up the surface of the world. It shares its top commander with NATO.

In a recent Ukrainian television interview the commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian army, Ruslan Khomchak, affirmed that the nationâ€™s armed forces are fully operational for a possible war, able to â€œprotect the territorial integrity and independence of our state.â€

Thatâ€™s true of any army, of course, but Khomchak was more specific: â€œTo accomplish this task, we must be ready to act both offensively and defensively and to carry out maneuvers. Of course we are preparing for the offensiveâ€¦.We have experience in warfare in eastern Ukraine.â€ Seven years of it in fact.

On February 8, President Zelensky approved a plan to admit foreign troops into Ukraine in 2021 to take part in several multinational military exercises led by the U.S. and other NATO nations, including the U.S.-led exercises Rapid Trident 2021 and Sea Breeze 2021, the British-Ukrainian Cossack Mace 2021 and Warrior Watcher 2021 exercises, the Romanian-Ukrainian Riverine 2021 exercise, and the Polish-Ukrainian Three Swords 2021 and Silver Sabre 2021 war games.

He also recently approved Ukraineâ€™s new military strategy, which not surprisingly emphasizes the subjugation of Donetsk and Lugansk and even Crimea. All-out assaults against the first two would probably provoke a war with Russia; an attack on the third would make it inevitable.

NATO is mentioned 19 times in the document, which speaks of an impending war with Donetsk and Lugansk, and by inference with Russia, in which Ukraine would be provided â€œthe help of the international community on terms favorable to Ukraine.â€

More pointedly it mentions depending on â€œthe political, economic and military support of Ukraine by the international community in its geopolitical confrontation with the Russian Federation.â€ The new military strategy also speaks of Ukraine becoming involved in a war between NATO and Russia in which Ukraine â€œwill be drawn into an international armed conflict, especially between nuclear-armed states.â€

The Euro-Atlantic integration of Ukraine advocated by Biden and Austin would make Ukraineâ€™s participation in a war between the worldâ€™s two major nuclear powers inevitable. It might also make Ukraine the main battleground in such a war.

Source title: Ukraine eine Demokratie? Die Kriegsparteien und ihre Wahlen | Von Wolfgang Effenberger
title: Ukraine eine Demokratie? Die Kriegsparteien und ihre Wahlen | Von Wolfgang Effenberger
text:
Podcast 0:00 / 1260 1Ã—

Ein Kommentar von Wolfgang Effenberger.

Vom 15. bis 17. MÃ¤rz 2024 (und mitunter auch online) (1) fanden in der Russischen FÃ¶deration PrÃ¤sidentschaftswahlen statt. In der Ukraine waren die PrÃ¤sidentschaftswahlen ursprÃ¼nglich fÃ¼r Ende MÃ¤rz 2024 angesetzt. Gleich zu Beginn der Wahlen in Russland gratulierte EU-RatsprÃ¤sident Charles Michel Wladimir Putin: â€Ich mÃ¶chte Wladimir Putin gerne zu seinem Erdrutschsieg bei den heute beginnenden Wahlen gratulieren. Keine Opposition. Keine Freiheit. Keine Auswahlâ€œ.(2)

Nach russischen BehÃ¶rdenangaben kam es wÃ¤hrend der Wahl zu mehreren Protest- und StÃ¶rversuchen in Wahllokalen. So hÃ¤tten Personen in 20 FÃ¤llen FlÃ¼ssigkeiten in Wahlurnen geschÃ¼ttet, um die Stimmzettel unbrauchbar zu machen. Auch sollen Molotow-Cocktails in Wahllokale geworfen oder auf andere Weise kleinere BrÃ¤nde gelegt worden sein. FÃ¼r diese StÃ¶raktionen machte die Vorsitzende der Wahlkommission, Ella Pamfilowa, ukrainische Geheimdienste und westliche Staaten verantwortlich.(3)

Begleitet wurde die dreitÃ¤gige Abstimmung von zahlreichen ukrainischen Drohnenangriffen. Allein in der Nacht auf Sonntag und SonntagfrÃ¼h wurden nach Angaben des Verteidigungsministeriums acht Regionen in Russland mit Drohnen angegriffen. AuÃŸerdem sollen pro-ukrainische KÃ¤mpfer in russisches Grenzgebiet vorgedrungen sein.(4)

FÃ¼r die (wirklich) mit Putin unzufriedenen Russen gab es keine Alternative. Der Kriegsgegner Boris Nadeschdin, der auch Verhandlungen mit der Ukraine versprochen hatte, war auf den Wahlzetteln nicht mehr zu finden. Und die zumeist heillos zerstrittene Opposition befindet sich aussichtslos im Ausland. Anstatt sich auf eine gemeinsame Protestform zu einigen, empfahl sie, beliebig andere Kandidaten als Putin zu wÃ¤hlen, den Wahlzettel ungÃ¼ltig zu machen oder am Sonntag um 12 Uhr am Wahllokal eine Schlange zu bilden.(5)

In Russland steht PrÃ¤sident Wladimir Putin vor seiner fÃ¼nften Amtszeit. Wie die Wahlkommission am Sonntag, den 17. MÃ¤rz 2024, abends im Staatsfernsehen mitteilte, erreichte Putin nach ersten AuszÃ¤hlungen der 114 Millionen WÃ¤hlerstimmen gut 87 Prozent, bei einer Wahlbeteiligung mit mehr als 70 Prozent, dem hÃ¶chsten Wert jemals bei einer russischen PrÃ¤sidentenwahl.(6) FÃ¼r westliche Beobachter weisen diese hohen Werte auf systematischen Betrug hin.

Am Sonntagabend Ã¤uÃŸerte sich Wladimir Putin nach Bekanntwerden seines beeindruckenden Wahlsieges Ã¼ber die Beziehungen zum Westen und den Dritten Weltkrieg. Die Reaktion des Westens auf die russischen PrÃ¤sidentschaftswahlen sei keine Ãœberraschung: â€Was haben Sie von ihnen erwartet, eine stehende Ovation? Sie kÃ¤mpfen gegen uns, sie kÃ¤mpfen militÃ¤rischâ€œ(7).

WÃ¤hrend der deutsche BundesprÃ¤sident Steinmeier Putin den GlÃ¼ckwunsch versagte, wurde auf der Plattform X (ehemals Twitter) eine ErklÃ¤rung des BundesprÃ¤sidenten verbreitet, in der es heiÃŸt: "Heute denke ich an die Menschen in Russland, die dort fÃ¼r Freiheit und Demokratie kÃ¤mpfen und in stÃ¤ndiger Gefahr vor Putins Regime leben. Wir vergessen diese Mutigen nicht."(8)

Putin sieht â€eine neue Generation von Fachleutenâ€œ mit einer â€realistischeren Sicht auf die aktuellen Ereignisseâ€œ die alte ablÃ¶sen. Der Westen wÃ¼rde nun gegen Russland â€auf raffiniertere Weiseâ€œ vorgehen. Seine Endziele bleiben jedoch unverÃ¤ndert. So sei ein ausgewachsener Konflikt zwischen Russland und der NATO nicht auszuschlieÃŸen. â€Ich denke, dass in der modernen Welt alles mÃ¶glich ist. Aber ich behaupte - und das ist jedem klar -, dass wir in diesem Fall nur einen Schritt von einem groÃŸen Dritten Weltkrieg entfernt sind. Ich glaube, dass kaum jemand daran interessiert ist, ihn zu haben.â€œ(9)

Hier kÃ¶nnte sich Putin irren:

Am Tag nach Putin Wahlsieg schrieb EU-RatsprÃ¤sident Charles Michel in einem Artikel, der in europÃ¤ischen Zeitungen und auf der Euractiv-Website verÃ¶ffentlicht wurde,

â€dass die EU verteidigungsbereit sein und in einen Kriegswirtschaftsmodus Ã¼bergehen mÃ¼sseâ€¦ Wenn wir Frieden wollen, mÃ¼ssen wir uns auf den Krieg vorbereiten."(10)

Das alte lateinische Sprichwort "Si vis pacem para bellum" (â€Wenn du (den) Frieden willst, bereite (den) Krieg vorâ€œ) hat nachweislich hÃ¤ufig das Gegenteil bewirkt.

Gleichzeitig berichtete das US-Magazin Newsweek Ã¼ber den Beginn des Baus der zukÃ¼nftig grÃ¶ÃŸten europÃ¤ischen MilitÃ¤rbasis der NATO in RumÃ¤nien, das schon lange als wichtiger Knotenpunkt fÃ¼r NATO-Operationen im Schwarzmeerraum dient. Die Anlage, die in der NÃ¤he der Hafenstadt ConstanÈ›a am Schwarzen Meer entsteht, wird voraussichtlich 10.000 NATO-Mitarbeiter und ihre Familien beherbergen und eine FlÃ¤che von fast 28 Quadratkilometern einnehmen. RumÃ¤nien strebt eine engere Zusammenarbeit mit seinen NATO-VerbÃ¼ndeten an, insbesondere mit den USA. Gleichzeitig wird das Schwarze Meer immer stÃ¤rker zum Schauplatz von Konfrontationen zwischen der Ukraine und Russland sowie zwischen Moskau und seinen westlichen Rivalen. Wie wird es wohl in der BevÃ¶lkerung Russlands aufgenommen werden, dass RumÃ¤nien wie 1941 den Schulterschluss mit dem Gegner vollzieht? Am 22. Juni 1941 beteiligte sich RumÃ¤nien mit 325.685 Mann und 207 Flugzeugen am deutschen Ãœberfall auf Russland.(11) Vom rumÃ¤nischen Hoheitsgebiet aus begann dann nach erfolgreichem VorstoÃŸ die deutsche â€Einsatzgruppe Dâ€œ mit der Judenvernichtung. Das alles dÃ¼rfte in Russland nicht vergessen sein.

Auf Ã„uÃŸerungen des franzÃ¶sischen PrÃ¤sidenten Emmanuel Macron zum Einsatz von Bodentruppen in der Ukraine und die Risiken und Chancen eines Konflikts zwischen Russland und der Nato angesprochen, antwortete Putin, dass jeder wisse, dass es dann nur noch ein Schritt zum groÃŸen Dritten Weltkrieg sei.(12) Dass nach Putins Worten in der Ukraine bereits zahlreiche Soldaten aus den Mitgliedsstaaten der NATO im Einsatz sind, lÃ¤sst die Distanz zum Krieg mit der NATO weiter schrumpfen.(13)

Der Weg in die Unvermeidlichkeit der direkten Auseinandersetzung zwischen Russland und der NATO zeichnet sich nach dem Treffen der "UnterstÃ¼tzer der Ukraine" auf der US-Luftwaffenbasis Ramstein am 19. MÃ¤rz 2024 klar ab. Obwohl im US-Kongress derzeit ein 60 Milliarden Dollar schweres Hilfspaket fÃ¼r die Ukraine festhÃ¤ngt, sicherte US-Verteidigungsminister Austin zu: â€Die USA werden die Ukraine nicht scheitern lassen.â€œ Es mÃ¼sse alles dafÃ¼r getan werden, dass Putin mit seinen â€imperialen PlÃ¤nenâ€œ nicht erfolgreich sei. â€Diese Koalition wird die Ukraine nicht scheitern lassen, die freie Welt wird die Ukraine nicht scheitern lassen.â€œ(14) Das war eine klare Botschaft an den Kreml.

Offen hatte sich vorher der russische PrÃ¤sident fÃ¼r GesprÃ¤che Ã¼ber den Vorschlag Frankreichs fÃ¼r eine Feuerpause in der Ukraine wÃ¤hrend der Olympischen Spiele (26. Juli bis zum 11. August in Paris) gezeigt â€“ unter der Voraussetzung, dass die Interessen des russischen MilitÃ¤rs an der Front berÃ¼cksichtigt werden mÃ¼ssten.

Das Wahlergebnis wird Putin fÃ¼r die kommenden 6 Jahre zusÃ¤tzlich LegitimitÃ¤t verschaffen.(15) Die AmtseinfÃ¼hrung des gewÃ¤hlten PrÃ¤sidenten ist fÃ¼r den 7. Mai 2024 vorgesehen.

Der ukrainische PrÃ¤sident Wolodimir Selenskij: Wahl in Russland hat keine LegitimitÃ¤t

Um den Ablauf der russischen PrÃ¤sidentschaftswahl zu stÃ¶ren, griff die Ukraine Russland mit Drohnen, Raketen und Artillerie an. Selenskij spricht dem Kremlchef seinen Wahlerfolg ab und zieht das Ergebnis der Wahl in Zweifel: â€œDiese WahlfÃ¤lschung hat keine LegitimitÃ¤t und kann keine habenâ€œ(16), sagte Selenskij nach dem Bekanntwerden des Wahlergebnisses.

Im Hinblick auf die Ende MÃ¤rz 2024 in der Ukraine angesetzten PrÃ¤sidentschaftswahlen entschied Wolodimir Selenskij: Es gibt keine PrÃ¤sidenten- und Parlamentswahlen in der Ukraine, solange sie im Kampf gegen Russland steht.(17) Das sei derzeit nicht angebracht. Die Ukraine mÃ¼sse sich auf die Verteidigung konzentrieren (das kÃ¶nne noch viele Jahre dauern). Dabei sollten die Ressourcen des Staates und der Ukrainer vielmehr auf "unseren Sieg" Ã¼ber Russland gerichtet werden, sagte Selenskyj.

â€Und wir alle verstehen, dass es jetzt in Kriegszeiten, wo es viele Herausforderungen gibt, absolut unverantwortlich ist, das Thema Wahlen leichtfertig und spielerisch in die Gesellschaft zu werfenâ€œ.(18)

Diese Aussage Selenskyjs entlarvt ihn als den diktatorischen Machthaber, als der immerzu Putin etikettiert wird. Nicht zuletzt auch deshalb, weil der frÃ¼here PrÃ¤sidentenberater Oleksij Arestowitsch durchaus chancenreich gegen seinen ehemaligen Chef antreten wollte. Obwohl die westlichen VerbÃ¼ndeten der Ukraine und insbesondere die USA Selenskyj gedrÃ¤ngt hatten, mÃ¶glichst bald im Land demokratische Wahlen abzuhalten, blieb Selenskyj hart.

Wie demokratisch ist die Ukraine unter Selenskyj?

Die Stichwahl im April 2019 gewann Selenski mit dem populistischen Versprechen, den Krieg zu beenden und den Einfluss der Oligarchen einzudÃ¤mmen - mit fragwÃ¼rdigem Erfolg.(19)

Anfang Februar 2021 unterschrieb Selenskyj das Gesetz Nr. 1131-IX. Damit erlaubte er, dass im Jahr 2021 mehr Truppen aus NATO-Staaten auf ukrainischem Territorium erscheinen durften. Geplant waren acht ManÃ¶ver auf ukrainischem Territorium, darunter Rapid Trident, Cossack Mace und Sea Breeze.(20)

Zudem war vorgesehen, dass ukrainische Truppen sich auch auÃŸerhalb der Ukraine an multinationalen Ãœbungen beteiligen sollten, an denen unter anderem auch NATO-Staaten und Georgien teilnehmen sollten. Mitte Februar 2021 eskalierten die KÃ¤mpfe zwischen den separatistischen Einheiten des Donbass und der Regierungsarmee in der Ostukraine. Wellen schlug das Dekret Nr. 117 vom 24. MÃ¤rz 2021, mit dem Selenskyj die Entscheidung des Nationalen Sicherheits- und Verteidigungsrates der Ukraine vom 11. MÃ¤rz 2021 (â€Zur Strategie der Entbesetzung und Wiedereingliederung des vorÃ¼bergehend besetzten Gebiets der Autonomen Republik Krim und der Stadt Sewastopolâ€œ) umzusetzen beabsichtigt. In dem Dekret wird die Vorbereitung von MaÃŸnahmen angekÃ¼ndigt, um â€die vorÃ¼bergehende Besetzungâ€œ der Krim und des Donbass zu beenden. Laut der staatlichen ukrainischen Nachrichtenagentur Ukrinform erhielt die Regierung den Auftrag, einen entsprechenden â€Aktionsplanâ€œ zu entwickeln.(21)

Im Dekret Nr. 121/2021 vom 25. MÃ¤rz 2021 stimmte Selenskyj der neuen ukrainischen MilitÃ¤rstrategie zu.(23) Darin wurde die Russische FÃ¶deration als Hauptgefahr fÃ¼r die Sicherheit des ukrainischen Staates benannt. (24)Sie sah unter anderem vor, die KrÃ¤fte der Territorialverteidigung zu stÃ¤rken, Waffen zu modernisieren und asymmetrische Verteidigung zu trainieren. Ende Juli 2021 unterzeichnete Selenskyj zwei weitere Gesetze, um die Anzahl der StreitkrÃ¤fte zu erhÃ¶hen, die Truppen der Territorialverteidigung und die Spezialeinheiten zu stÃ¤rken sowie die BevÃ¶lkerung auf nationalen Widerstand vorzubereiten.

Im August 2021 gab Selenskyj AuskÃ¼nfte Ã¼ber die PlÃ¤ne, die ukrainische Flotte mit UnterstÃ¼tzung der EuropÃ¤ischen Union, des Vereinigten KÃ¶nigreichs und der USA bis 2035 auszubauen. ZukÃ¼nftiges Ziel war es, die Blockierungen an den KÃ¼sten des Schwarzen und des Asowschen Meeres zu Ã¼berwinden und der Okkupation der Krim entgegenzuwirken. Parallel zur angestrebten Militarisierung wurde die Meinungsfreiheit eingeschrÃ¤nkt. Anfang Februar 2021 setzte Selenskyj die Entscheidung des Nationalen Sicherheits- und Verteidigungsrates um - ihm gehÃ¶ren neben Selenskyj auch Vertreter von Justiz und Geheimdiensten sowie Regierungsmitglieder an â€“ und sanktionierte die drei prorussischen Fernsehsender ZIK, NewsOne und 112 Ukraine, die Taras Kozak, einem Mitglied der grÃ¶ÃŸten Oppositionspartei Oppositionsplattform â€“ FÃ¼r das Leben, gehÃ¶rten und Teil des Medienimperiums von Wiktor Medwedtschuks waren, der unverzÃ¼glich unter Hausarrest gestellt wurde.(25) Damit sei laut Selenskyj â€Medwedtschuk die MÃ¶glichkeit genommen, Medien und Staatseigentum dafÃ¼r zu nutzen, offen auf das Land einzuschlagen und der Sicherheit des Staates einen ruinÃ¶sen Schaden zuzufÃ¼genâ€œ(26). Der Staat wÃ¼rde keine Propaganda der Russischen FÃ¶deration unterstÃ¼tzen, die die Ukraine davon abhalte, sich in die EuropÃ¤ische Union und die NATO zu integrieren. Selenskyj stellte sein Handeln als Teil des Informationskriegs um Wahrheit und europÃ¤ische Werte dar.

Daraufhin warf Putin den europÃ¤ischen Politikern doppelte Standards vor, da diese die Verbote entweder nicht kommentiert oder gar befÃ¼rwortet hÃ¤tten.(27) Er Ã¤uÃŸerte, mit diesem Vorgehen verfolge der Westen geopolitische Ziele gegen die Russische FÃ¶deration.

Im MÃ¤rz 2022, wenige Tage nach dem russischen Angriff, unterzeichnete Selenskyj das Dekret Nr. 152/2022. Es sah vor, alle ukrainischen FernsehkanÃ¤le in einer Plattform zu vereinen, da im Krieg eine einheitliche Informationspolitik betrieben werden mÃ¼sse.(28) Der Nationale Rat fÃ¼r Fernsehen und Rundfunk wurde angewiesen, MaÃŸnahmen zu ergreifen, um die Entscheidung umzusetzen.(29) Kritiker des Einheitsprogramms wandten ein, dass die Kritiker Selenskyjs kaum zu sehen seien. Kritiker kamen eher in kleineren Sendern, die nicht am Einheitsprogramm teilnahmen, zu Wort. Allerdings hatten diese Sender Probleme, ihre Programme Ã¼ber landesweite Sendemasten zu Ã¼bertragen, so dass sie ihr Signal Ã¼ber Satellit oder Internet verbreiten mussten, wie zum Beispiel Espreso TV. Zudem beklagte der Sender 5 Kanal, der Petro Poroschenko nahestand und sich nicht am Einheitsprogramm beteiligte, dass dem Kanal Sendefrequenzen entzogen worden seien.(30)

Der Chef des ukrainischen Journalistenverbands, Nikolaj Tomilenko, sprach von einer "Informationsbombe": "Der Entzug des Zugangs zu ukrainischen Medien fÃ¼r ein Millionenpublikum ohne Gericht (...) ist ein Angriff auf die Meinungsfreiheit."(31) Die Oppositionsplattform kÃ¼ndigte unterdessen den Beginn eines Amtsenthebungsverfahrens gegen Selenskyj an. Die Partei verfÃ¼gt allerdings nur Ã¼ber 44 der notwendigen 226 Sitze im Parlament, um ein solches Verfahren einzuleiten. Beobachter halten den Versuch daher fÃ¼r aussichtslos.

Ein Dekret des ukrainischen PrÃ¤sidenten Wolodymyr Selenskyj, mit dem er im April 2022 die AktivitÃ¤ten von elf Parteien verboten hat, bewerten Fachleute kritisch. Betroffen sind unter anderem zwei Oppositionsparteien, die als prorussisch gelten. Daneben werden die AktivitÃ¤ten von vor allem regionalen Parteien beschrÃ¤nkt, von denen die meisten als links gelten. Selenskyj begrÃ¼ndete seine Entscheidung damit, dass diese Parteien Verbindungen zu Russland hÃ¤tten.(32) Nachdem in der Ukraine 11 Oppositionsparteien verboten und Meinungs- und Pressefreiheit ausgehebelt und die Medien gleichgeschaltet wurden, kann man von der Ukraine nicht mehr als eine Demokratie sprechen: Ihre Werte sind nicht die unseren! Aus der Ukraine heraus sind keine ukraine-kritischen Berichte deutscher Journalisten zugelassen (aus Moskau heraus sind russlandkritische Kommentare deutscher Journalisten durchaus Ã¼blich). In der Ukraine sind politische Morde an der Tagesordnung. So fÃ¼hrt auch die Spur der MÃ¶rder der russischen Journalistin Darja Dugina am 20. August 2022 nach Kiew.

Die Ukraine gehÃ¶rt wie Russland zu den korruptesten LÃ¤ndern Europas und belegt auf dem Korruptionsindex von Transparency International Platz 116 von 180 (dahinter noch Russland).(33)

Der Freikauf vom Wehrdienst ist in der Ukraine genauso Ã¼blich wie in Russland. Die Ukraine steht mit ihrem SÃ¼ndenregister von BrÃ¼chen von StaatsvertrÃ¤gen und von Verletzungen von UN Konventionen und internationalen Chartas dem russischen Register in HÃ¤ufigkeit und Schwere in nichts nach. Die Art und HÃ¤ufigkeit von ukrainischen Kriegsverbrechen sind denen von russischer Seite gleich, lediglich der Missbrauch kriegsvÃ¶lkerrechtlich geschÃ¼tzter humanitÃ¤rer Einrichtungen als Schutzschilde fÃ¼r kÃ¤mpfende Truppen kommt allein auf ukrainischer Seite vor (lt. Bericht des OSZE vom 29.6. 2022 ).

FÃ¼r den ehemaligen Generalmajor Gerd Schultze Rhonhof ist diese â€Ukraine weder eine Demokratie, noch steht sie fÃ¼r unsere Werte, wie uns die deutschen Medien und die Mehrheit unserer Parteien vortÃ¤uschen. Die uns von offizieller Seite prÃ¤sentierte Interpretation, dass die Ukraine unsere Werte mitverteidigen wÃ¼rde, ist so tÃ¶richt wie Strucks â€Deutschland-Verteidigung am Hindukuschâ€œ es war.(34)

Putin muss nach Willen von Selenskyj auf der Anklagebank in Den Haag landen â€“ â€dafÃ¼r mÃ¼ssen wir sorgen, jeder auf der Welt, der das Leben und den Anstand schÃ¤tzt.â€œ(35) Zu den Forderungen der Ukraine fÃ¼r ein Friedensabkommen mit Moskau gehÃ¶rt unter anderem, dass sich die russischen Verantwortlichen in Politik und MilitÃ¤r vor einem internationalen Gericht verantworten sollen. Selenskyjs Forderung wird einen Krieg bis zur totalen ErschÃ¶pfung nach sich ziehen: Zur Freude der HÃ¤ndler des Todes (Banker und RÃ¼stungsindustrielle).

Bereits 1935 hatte die amerikanische KÃ¼nstlerin Mabel Dwight auf diese Profiteure von Krieg und Krisen hingewiesen.

â€Die HÃ¤ndler des Todes sind zÃ¤h und langlebigâ€¦ihr alleiniges Interesse ist das Eigeninteresse, ihr alleiniger Gott ist der Profit. â€¦ Als Politiker richtet sich ihr Interesse auf eine starke Herrscherklasse und die BÃ¼ndelung von Privilegien â€¦ Was sie jedoch selten begreifen ist, dass der Tod ihr AnfÃ¼hrer ist. Er weiÃŸ, dass sie Kriege und Revolutionen ausbrÃ¼ten ... ihre HartnÃ¤ckigkeit und ihre althergebrachte Dummheit Ã¼bersteigen jedes verstÃ¤ndliche MaÃŸ. Wir sprechen hier Ã¼ber Wesen, die ausgesprochen scharfsichtig, dabei aber unheilbar kurzsichtig sind. In diesem Land hassen sie das Ideal der Demokratie, doch sind sie froh Ã¼ber die lockeren ZÃ¼gel und den Freiraum, den sie ihnen lÃ¤sst.â€œ(37)

Das hatte 1795 der groÃŸe Philosoph Immanuel Kant, dessen Geburtstag sich am 22. April 2024 zum 300. Mal jÃ¤hrt, erkannt. Er dÃ¤mpft seine idealistischen Erwartungen mit der Einsicht, dass die Macht des Geldes immer wieder fÃ¼r Krieg und ZerstÃ¶rung sorgen wird, dass unter der

â€Heeresmacht, der Bundesmacht und der Geldmacht die Letztere wohl das zuverlÃ¤ssigste Kriegswerkzeug sein dÃ¼rfteâ€œ.(38)

Mit der Charta der Vereinten Nationen, die weitgehend von Kants Schrift â€Zum Ewigen Friedenâ€œ inspiriert ist, keimte nach zwei Weltkriegen Hoffnung auf eine friedlichere Welt auf. In der PrÃ¤ambel wurde zugesichert, die Geschlechter vor der GeiÃŸel des Krieges zu bewahren und die Grundrechte des Menschen zu achten. FÃ¼r diese Zwecke wollte man Duldsamkeit Ã¼ben und als gute Nachbarn in Frieden miteinander leben. Diese Hoffnungen scheinen endgÃ¼ltig zerstoben zu sein.

Nun bewegt sich Europa, ohne zur Besinnung zu kommen, konsequent und zÃ¼gig auf einen Krieg mit Russland zu.

Quellen und Anmerkungen

Wolfgang Effenberger, Jahrgang 1946, erhielt als Pionierhauptmann bei der Bundeswehr tiefere Einblicke in das von den USA vorbereitete "atomare Gefechtsfeld" in Europa. Nach zwÃ¶lfjÃ¤hriger Dienstzeit studierte er in MÃ¼nchen Politikwissenschaft sowie HÃ¶heres Lehramt (Bauwesen/Mathematik) und unterrichtete bis 2000 an der Fachschule fÃ¼r Bautechnik. Seitdem publiziert er zur jÃ¼ngeren deutschen Geschichte und zur US-Geopolitik. Zuletzt erschienen vom ihm

â€Schwarzbuch EU & NATOâ€œ (2020)

sowie

"Die unterschÃ¤tzte Macht" (2022)

Source title: The Tyranny of Fashion: Shredding Banksy | Dissident Voice
title: The Tyranny of Fashion: Shredding Banksy
text:
The modern art world is filled with pranks and pranksters, the clowns who have decided that play counts for art. Brattish artists foist a range of projects and conceptual themes upon art galleries who, foolishly, see emperors decked in the finest wear. They refuse to consider that the wear is absent, an expensive mirage that tells to an old tale of the imperial ruler without clothes.

This is a world of transaction, appearance and display, based on conceit and seduction, the toying by the super star artist of the necessarily gullible, and the acceptance on their part they are bearing witness to the exceptional. When Banksyâ€™s Girl with Balloon was shredded at Sothebyâ€™s (a sort of art styled seppuku), it was subsequently, and all too quickly, transformed into Love is in the Bin. Technicians in the room did not seem too fussed by the occurrence, and diligently went about their business of retouching the new piece for the market amidst nervous laughter and much tittering. Banksyâ€™s own company Pest Control granted the work a new certificate. Another prank had been played.

The anonymous woman who had initially bid for the previous painting at the point of shredding found herself in raptures, but had to play along as initially shocked. (She may well have been, but this posture seemed distinctly contrived.) The Â£1,042,000 was well spent, thank you very much. â€œWhen the hammer came down last week and the work was shredded, I was at first shocked, but gradually I began to realise that I would end up with my own piece of art history,â€ came the observation from the buyer.

Marketing executive Stephanie Fielding feels that Sothebyâ€™s would have been in on it. â€œOne would hope in an age of security consciousness they would have known that such a contraption was inside the artwork.â€ Sothebyâ€™s did little to dispel this notion, boasting that the new work had been â€œcreated in our salesroomâ€, and was â€œthe first work in history ever created during a live auction.â€ Its employees also added to the tattle, a layering of playfulness. â€œI donâ€™t think we knew,â€ came the guarded receptionist, â€œbut weâ€™re not allowed to say anymore.â€

Put another way, in an age constipated by its preoccupation with health and safety mania, Banksy would never have been able to pull this off without collaborating insiders and complicit agents. Not that it convinces the likes of photographer Matteo Perazzo, who clings, charmingly, to the belief that Banksy remains â€œopposed to the art establishment, so it would be weird if he had colluded with them.â€ With such opponents, who needs a true resistance?

Then comes the element of complicity with and in the establishment itself. Banksy realised, long ago, that his resistance to the system was its own acceptance. His entire approach was premised on mocking something that would, in time, be seen as something to assimilate. To that end, it is unsurprising that questions should be asked of Sothebyâ€™s itself.

The same point can be made of the entire art market and the notion of â€œstreetâ€ stencilling that used to be frowned upon as inventions of graffiti. It did not take long for such street dabbling to become the stuff of auctions, to make its way into the richest galleries and homes of private collectors.

It is fitting that nothing of this is aesthetic or remarkable. The key is the subversion of convention that, in times, becomes conventional: Marcel Duchampâ€™s Fountain signed by a â€œR. Mutt 1917â€ subverts conventional form to become art, turning a porcelain urinal into marketable commodity; a painting at auction is shredded, thereby creating a surge of shredding in other quarters in a blitz of increasing art value. (This can severely backfire â€“ an owner of a Banksy print decided to vandalise his own possession, dramatically reducing its value.)

Even critics of the sober disposition of Will Gompertz claimed to be wrong in suggesting that artists for the past century had â€œfailed to outwit and outdo Marcel Duchampâ€. There had been efforts to destroy and obliterate works â€“ Robert Rauschenbergâ€™s rubbing out of a drawing by Dutch artist Willem de Kooning in 1953 stands out as a tendentious example that fell short. It took Banksy, claimed the gushing Gompertz, to make him realise â€œthat there was an artwork hanging on the walls of a London auction house which was about to do just thatâ€, another Duchamp-like experiment that could be carried off. In what smacks of unnecessary prostration before the gimmick, he suggests that Love is in the Bin â€œwill come to be seen as one of the most significant artworks of the early 21st century.â€

The late Australian art critic Robert Hughes, constantly sharp on the effects of speculation in art, reflected upon the phenomenon in 2004. His speech at Burlington House was a defence of the Royal Academy, a body he hoped could be rebooted to face the degradation brought on by wealthy collectors. He had â€œalways been suspicious of the effects of speculation in artâ€; after 30 years in New York he had â€œseen a lot of the damage it can do: the sudden puffing of reputations, the throwing of eggs in the air to admire their short grace of flight, the tyranny of fashion.â€

Banksy is less talent than a search, a hunt for the next saleable stunt which might be authentic or otherwise (fake smatterings of graffiti purportedly by the artist, by way of example, were reported in Kyiv this July); less an issue of durable statement than publicity on heat. So much so that a theory doing the rounds is that the entire shredding show was an act of inauthenticity, fakery again doing its heralded rounds in the art world. Josh Gilbert, a Chicago blacksmith and artist, is one suggesting that there was â€œno way these blades would cut canvas or even thick paper mounted that way.â€ This all reeked â€œof misdirectionâ€.

Banksy is the modern statement of PR, not enduring but fleeting, an attempt to be permanently newsworthy. At a time where an orange haired monster remains all powerful in garnering headlines and proffering conspiracies in Washington, tweeting with the abandon of a wannabe felon, the likes of Banksy struggle. Times must be tough, hence the shredder. What next in that tyranny of prank peppered fashion?
